page.title: 02THE EFFECT OF DOUNREAY
page.content: Due to the coming of the Prototype Fast Breeder Reactor at Dounreay, Reay has had considerable improvements made to it and its surroundings. The roads into Reay have been improved considerably because of increased volumes of traffic to and from the plant which lies on the main Thurso to Reay road. The United Kingdom Atomic Energy Authority (UKAEA) has made provision for snowploughs to keep the road to Dounreay clear during the winter, to allow workers to reach the plant, but this also means that it is relatively easy for the inhabitants of Reay and its surroundings to travel to Thurso when all the other roads in the county may be impassable.
